utterance.speaker: Mr. Treeger
utterance.content: Ohhh, man!!

utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.content: Treeger’s snaking the shower drain.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Treeger

utterance.content: Maybe he found you flip-flop.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa! Is this porn? What did I do? I must’ve hit something on the remote.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do we pay for this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, we didn’t even pay our cable bill—maybe this is how they punish us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our phone bill—free phone sex.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our gas bill?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Treeger
utterance.content: Whoa, hey, that lady’s all kinds of naked.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, Joey just pressed something on the remote and it just, came on!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Treeger
utterance.content: Yeah, it happened to me once. I was just flipping through the channels and bam! It was like finding money.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Like finding money with naked people on it!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Treeger
utterance.content: Then I made the mistake of turning off the TV, I never got it back again. And I’m sad.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would he turn off the TV?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, y’know what, come on, do we really have to watch this while we eat?

utterance.speaker: Joey and Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We don’t know what could make this go away.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, so no one touches the remote. And no one touches the TV!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And no one touches the air around the TV!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Imagine a protective porn bubble if you will, okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well at least, I’m going to mute it.

utterance.speaker: Joey and Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We still have porn.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, what are you doing? That’s too heavy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Give it here. Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, I’m getting too pregnant for this, lugging around a stupid massage table. Y’know, I have to find a job where I carrying a smaller table.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Or a job where you don’t have to carry a table.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You mean like a doctor?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs! You’re blocking the porn! Look out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh! Oh my. Oh, that reminds me, I have to see my OB-GYN today.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, Emily just went to the airport.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Why didn’t you take her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh, her-her uncle already had planned on doing it. And y’know, we-we said our good-byes this morning, so…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You must feel horrible. Hey! The guys have free porn!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, cheer up! You’re gonna see her again, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I, that’s the thing, I don’t know! I mean, whenever I brought it up with her she said, "This is so fantastic! Why do we have to talk about the future? Let’s just enjoy…"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no-no, don’t-don’t do the accent. You’ve got to see her again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And why do you care so much?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because! You could get to live out my fantasy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You had fantasies about Emily?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Y’know, the fantasy! Meet someone from a strange land, fall in madly love, and spend the rest of your lives together.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is that why in junior high you were the only one that hung out with that Ukrainian kid?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah that, plus his mom used to put sour cream on everything!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you love her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We said it was only going to be two weeks, y’know?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You love her!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What-what is love really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohhh, I knew you loved her! Then you need to go to the airport and tell her. You’re probably just gonna catch her just as she’s about to go to the gate. You’re gonna call out her name and say, "I love you!" And she’s gonna say, "I love you, too!" And you guys are going to have the most amazing kiss, everyone at the gate will applaud.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am a good kisser.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then you two can, can sneak into the cockpit, and things will start to heat up, and then a stewardess comes in… I’ve been watching too much porn.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is that the heartbeat?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow! This is so cool.

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Have we talked about the possibility of multiple births?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don’t take care of this one, and should I get pregnant again, I’ll hold onto your card, okay?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: No, I’m getting three separate heartbeats.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Three? You guys were worried I wouldn’t even have one!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Doctors are wrong all the time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, so, are-are you sure that there are three?!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Definitely.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!! So I-I mean so in a few months I’m going to have three full grown babies just walkin’ around inside me?! Oh! Oh! And it’s gonna be one of those log rides where they just come shooting out!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Actually, giving birth to three babies isn’t that different from giving birth to one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What do you know?!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Oh-oh, Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Hi! So, how did it go at the doctors?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh well, okay, hey, y’know how when you’re umm, you’re walking down the street and you see three people in a row, and you say, "Oh, that’s nice?"

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, yeah well, good news, you’re going to have three babies.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Three babies?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: I finally got my band!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: We’re gonna have a big family, I’ve always wanted a big family!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh God, I’m so glad you guys are happy, I was so afraid you were going to be all freaked.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Why would we be freaked?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no maybe ‘cause it’s harder to raise them, and the added expense, and…

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, back to happy. Back to happy!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: No-no-no, no, it’s going to be fine. Because umm, because I teach Home Ec, and uh, I can have 30 kids making baby clothes all year long. Y’know it’ll-it’ll be like my very own little sweatshop.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve been thinking ever since you said we were having triplets, the best thing for me to do is to drop out of college and get a job.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: No, Frank.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No you can’t quit college! No! You’re in college? Really?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yeah, refrigerator college.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yeah, y’know when we found out we were going to have a baby, y’know I figured y’know like I should y’know have like a career—and I love refrigerators!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You can’t give up on your dream.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. We’re-we’re gonna have three kids! And that’s-that’s a different kind of dream. Three kids and no money.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: This is the boarding call for Flight 009.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emily!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh my God! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just, I had to see you one more time before you took-off.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You are so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s, that’s, that’s a big candy bar. I had the most amazing time with you.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: This is the final boarding call for Flight 009.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well, that’ me. Here, have this. I’m only allowed one piece of carryon anyway.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait uh, listen. I-I, I have to tell you something. Umm, I’ve been thinking, I’m just gonna come out and say it. Okay? I-I-I ah, I-I think I love you.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s no problem.

utterance.content: What’s that song? It has been in my head all day long.

utterance.content: Y’know who doesn’t even like dirty movies? My new boyfriend Joshua.

utterance.content: Yeah right.

utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.content: Yeah, he likes porn.

utterance.content: Hey!

Okay, insider trading, what information is there that you can give me.

utterance.content: They don’t really talk to us about that kind of stuff. I can get you some free white out though.

utterance.content: Ohh! Did you do what I said? Did-did-did you tell her?

utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And well, what did she say?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you’re totally welcome! What’d she say?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She said, "Thank you." I said, "I love you." And she said, "Thank you."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, wait a minute, did you say, you love her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, what were you trying to get her to do?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do I do now?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You play hard to get.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She already lives in London.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then you go to Tokyo.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right look, forget it, forget it. You told her you love her, it’s over.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It is not over! You’re over!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Good one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It is not over because she is going to call you and tell you she loves you. And the reason why she couldn’t, is because her feelings were so strong, it scared her. Now you go home and wait for her call, she could be calling you from the plane! Come on now go! Go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! But if she doesn’t call, it is definitely over! No, wait. Wait. Unless, eventually, I call her, y’know just to she what’s going on, and, and she says she’ll call me back, but then she doesn’t. Then it’s over.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Way to be strong, man!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi! Listen, can we watch cartoons on your television? We need a porn break. We spent the last two hours watching In Out In, Again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, so, why don’t you just turn it off?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because then we would be the guys who turned off free porn.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, good, you’re hear! Okay.

utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.content: Well, what-what ‘cha got there?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh this, well I’m glad you asked. Now, don’t you hate it when you have to cut a tin can with an ordinary steak knife? Ahh! Now, I know what you’re thinking…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, you’re not gonna make enough money to help Frank and Alice just by selling knives.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no, I know that, but I just have to make enough money for the second part of my plan.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s the second part of your plan?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My Saturn dealership.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those wonderful things.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, that-that, that’s all right. Umm, I’m just glad you called.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ross umm, there’s something that I’ve got to tell you, there’s-there’s someone else.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She doesn’t know which one of us she wants, me or this Colin guy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This isn’t how it’s supposed to go, there can’t be another guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Of course there’s another guy!! This is even more perfect! Now you have to prove your love!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m not proving anything. Okay, I’m done listening to you. If I hadn’t let you talk me into going to the airport in the first place, I never would’ve put my fist through the wall!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You put your fist through the wall?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I missed and hit the door. But, it opened really hard!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You have to go to London!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, you have to go fight for her!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, sure, that makes sense. Yeah. ‘Cause you already told her you love her and she didn’t say it back, then she called you and told you that there’s another guy, so yeah, go to London that’ll scare her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: When Rachel was with Paulo, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I made fun of his accent.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You sat back and let him have her, you didn’t fight at all. Am I right? Do you want the same thing to happen with Emily?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right then, go fight for her! Go to London! I mean, that could be you and Emily! That, but-but nicer. Just, go to London!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on! Surprise her! Show up at her doorstep! Don’t let her go without a fight!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right. All right, I’m gonna do it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to London and I’m going to fight for her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, good luck!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross! Ross! If you’re going to the airport, could you pick me up another one of those Toblerone bars?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh-Ooh! I did it! I did it! I figured out a way to make money! I’m gonna open up my own massage place and Frank’s gonna help me! And! We can work it around his schedule so he doesn’t have to quit school!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s sounds great, but how are you going to afford it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, we were walking down the street and we saw that van that you guys used for catering and we realised…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m telling it! I’m telling it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. You know how people need transportation, but they also need massages to help them relax so I just figured we could combine the two, okay, I give the massages and Frank drives! I can fix up the van, bolt the table in the back, and you know what I’ve got?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A place where no one will ever get out alive?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Think about it, it’s a taxi that people take when they need to relax, it’s…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Relaxi-Taxi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The name was my favourite part!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, well I can up with it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: YOU DID NOT!!!! Oh! No! You came up with Relaxi Cab! That’s not good.

utterance.content: Well, I…

utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! Ross, are you in England? Was Emily surprised?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, because she hasn’t come home yet. And she hasn’t been home all night! She’s obviously staying with that other guy, and I’m the stupid moron who spent the whole night outside her apartment!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right. When is, when is the next flight out?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: About four hours.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, just stay there a couple more hours and if she doesn’t show up by then, then just come on home.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, tell him about Relaxi-Taxi, and-and ask him if he thinks that’s better than Relaxi Cab.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, it’s not Relaxi Cab. It’s Relaxicab, like taxicab.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that is better.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are we in London?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing here? You can’t be here!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I’ve uh, I’ve come to talk to Ross.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nothing. No, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I was going to call him, but…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! I was right! I’m right, right?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I’d really rather talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I uh, I’ve been to his apartment and he wasn’t there, and uh. I need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ross, are you there? Ross, I don’t know if you can hear this but… I’m gonna talk anyway, uh, I’m in the States with you sister and your friends and it’s all over with Colin. I came here to tell you that, and to tell you—Yes, Joey you can have all the chocolate you want, just take it! Uh, I came here to tell you that I love you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I love you too! I’m, I’m gonna call you right now from the phone booth! You can’t hear me.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I wish I could know if you’d heard any of that. I suppose I’ve either just told you I love you or given my neighbours a good laugh. Mrs. Newman if you’re listening, bugger off this in none of your business. I suppose there’s not much chance you did heard that, and there’s the call waiting so, I should go. Oh well. Hello.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: All right, ready?

utterance.content: One.
